com.thinkaurelius.titan.graphdb.transaction.vertexcache

Interface VertexCache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GuavaVertexCache, LRUVertexCache

    public interface VertexCache

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(InternalVertex vertex, long id)
      Adds the given vertex with the given id to the cache.
      void close()
      Closes the cache which allows the cache to release allocated memory.
      boolean contains(long id)
      Checks whether the cache contains a vertex with the given id
      InternalVertex get(long id, Retriever<Long,InternalVertex> retriever)
      Returns the vertex with the given id or null if it is not in the cache
      List<InternalVertex> getAllNew()
      Returns an iterable over all new vertices in the cache

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains(long id)
        Checks whether the cache contains a vertex with the given id
        Parameters:
        id - Vertex id
        Returns:
        true if a vertex with the given id is contained, else false

      • get

        InternalVertex get(long id,
                 Retriever<Long,InternalVertex> retriever)
        Returns the vertex with the given id or null if it is not in the cache
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:

      • add

        void add(InternalVertex vertex,
       long id)
        Adds the given vertex with the given id to the cache. The given vertex may already be in the cache. In other words, this method may be called to ensure that a vertex is still in the cache.
        Parameters:
        vertex -
        id -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the vertex is null or the id negative

      • getAllNew

        List<InternalVertex> getAllNew()
        Returns an iterable over all new vertices in the cache
        Returns:

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the cache which allows the cache to release allocated memory. Calling any of the other methods after closing a cache has undetermined behavior.
